This role also contributes to our governance, threat modeling, threat intelligence, and training and awareness initiatives. The Technology & Cyber Risks team sits within our Security and Compliance Department and plays a central role in identifying, assessing, and managing risks before they impact the organization. Responsibilities • Assisting in risk assessments for IT, OT and third-party vendors, documenting findings and tracking remediation progress. • Supporting threat modeling activities for new projects, technologies, and applications. • Monitoring and triaging threat intelligence reports to identify emerging risks relevant to the organization. • Assisting in the development of governance artifacts such as risk registers, control assessments, and compliance reporting. • Contributing to security awareness and training programs, including preparing materials and supporting internal campaigns. Documenting processes, updating standard operating procedures, and helping to create risk dashboards and reports. • What We Offer: • Work Environment - Work in our beautiful home office building with access to a fitness facility, onsite nurse, and a café • Hybrid Work Model - Allows for a blend of in-office and work-from-home days • Competitive Compensation - including a parking allowance • Housing Allowance- Students may be eligible for housing allowance if they are required to relocate to Saint John. • Co-op Fee Reimbursement- Students may be eligible to have their fees for this placement paid for if they are enrolled in a co-op program. • Wellness Support - With 24/7 access to our Employee & Family Assistance Program • Opportunity to give back to some amazing causes in our community - Choose when and where to make an impact with a paid volunteer day, company volunteer opportunities, and a donation matching program Irving Oil is committed to supporting a diverse and inclusive work environment. Job Requirements Your Skills: • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Attention to detail and an interest in risk management methodologies. • Your Experience: • Currently enrolled in an IT program • Must have completed at least one year of post-secondary education and be returning to school • Completed or pursuing coursework in cybersecurity fundamentals, governance, risk management, and compliance.
